column1: The Oldbuck Family was an ancient family of Shire-hobbits
column2: who went on to become one of the most well-known families of Shire.
the members of this prosperous family came from the Marish
column3: where they traced their heritage to one Bucca of the Marish
column4: the first Thain of the Shire. Thainship was in the Oldbuck family until  (S.R. 740).

column2: they settled across the Brandywine by Gorhendad Oldbuck
column3: who later changed their surname to Brandybuck Family

column1: Oldbuck is the English translation of the genuine Hobbitish name Zaragamba Family
The word Wiktionary:buck means "goat" or "deer". It is the ultimate origin of the placename Buckland which means "Land of the deer".Mark T. Hooker
